page.title: 12River Derwent near Bubwith
page.content: If you go to Bubwith it is pleasant to walk north of the bridge along the {Ings}(short for floodings). The {Derwent Ings}hold all the excess water from the north Yorkshire moors. Usually bullocks are grazing on the eastern side and sheep on the western side. The{Yorkshire Water Authority controls the river and provides thousands of gallons of drinking water for Sheffield, Hull, Rotherham, and Barnsley. The{Ings}are important for wild plants because the farmers are not using weed killers.The grass is good and farmers can take two crops of hay each summer from the banks. Many species of birds use the ings particularly migrant winter birds.There is an argument between tourism and conservation groups.
